etymology.description: Pictogram (象形) – picture of a ram’s head.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a ram’s head with prominent horns above and facial/beard lines below. The image directly conveys the meaning of “sheep,” and its recognizable silhouette later served as a component in related characters.

examples.chinese: 我家养了三只羊(我家養了三隻羊)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jiā yǎng le sān zhī yáng.

examples.chinese: 那只羊很温顺(那隻羊很溫順)。
山上有很多野羊(山上有很多野羊)。
examples.pinyin: Shān shàng yǒu hěn duō yěyáng.
examples.english: There are many wild sheep in the mountains.
